intro: Thesium spinulosum, commonly known as the hairy thesium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its leaves are typically hairy and evergreen, adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments. Thesium spinulosum is often found in fynbos vegetation, showcasing its ecological significance in South African flora.
